titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hudson-Fulton Celebration collection CBHM.0034
titlestmt.author: Dee Bowers

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2026-01-30 21:30:20 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: in one manuscript box and one oversize folder.

did.abstract: Publications, ephemera and photographs from the 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration in New York City and elsewhere along the Hudson River.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The napkin was the gift of Harriet Stryker-Rodda, 1974. The photographs were the gift of Gerard W.B. Gardner, 1981. The sources and dates of acquisition for the remainder of the collection are unknown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged into 14 folders by type.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Hudson-Fulton Celebration was a two week event held in September and October of 1909 commemorating both the 300th anniversary of Henry Hudson's arrival at what we now call the Hudson River and the 100th anniversary of Robert Fulton's first successful run of his steamboat service between New York City and Albany, N.Y. Events held during the celebration included parades, fireworks, concerts, exhibitions, and the illumination of the exteriors of various buildings, bridges, and monuments throughout New York City with electric lights. Events took place throughout New York City, as well as in several cities located along the Hudson River. A major attraction of the Celebration was the participation of the U.S. Navy Atlantic Fleet. The main Brooklyn pageant began at the Soldiers and Sailors' Memorial Arch in Grand Army Plaza and continued on Eastern Parkway to Buffalo Avenue.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Hudson-Fulton Celebration collection, CBHM.0034, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was created by CBH Archives Manager Dee Bowers in January 2026 after a number of related publications were found in collection among books and other publications that had been stored off site for many years. The publications were combined with accessions 1978.110 and V1990.054 as well as materials from the Brooklyn ephemera collection (BCMS.0007) and the Brooklyn Historical Society ephemera collection (ARC.272) to form one united collection documenting the Hudson-Fulton Celebration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publications, ephemera and photographs from the 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration in New York City and elsewhere along the Hudson River. The publications include officially authorized publications as well as those published by the Celebration Commission itself. There are also programs and souvenir publications from other sources, such as the New York State Education Department, the Jersey City Free Public Library and the Fulton Trust Company.

There are three items specific to the festivities in Brooklyn: a calendar of events, a list of members on the Brooklyn Citizens' Committee, and a napkin from a Brooklyn event during the Celebration. Additionally, six photographs depict various structures around New York City (but mostly in Brooklyn) illuminated with electric lights in honor of the Celebration.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This materials in this collection are in the public domain.

While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

did.unittitle: Celebration Commission minutes and committtee list

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official Program, Carnival Pageant official souvenir booklet, and Historical Pageant program. Printed for the Commission by Redfield Brothers, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Schedule of events, medal, and badge announcement booklets.

did.unittitle: Hudson and Fulton by Edward Hagaman Hall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies, first edition and third edition. "A brief history of Henry Hudson and Robert Fulton with suggestions designed to aid the holding of general commemorative exercises and children's festivals during the Hudson-Fulton Celebration." Published by the Celebration Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Compiled and published by the Committee on Dedications for use of the Societies and Organizations dedicating memorials under the auspices of the…Celebration Commission."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Issued…by the Public Health and Convenience Committee of the…Celebration Commission."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issued by the Commission/George M. Moran.

did.unittitle: Testimonials of Appreciation to Herman Ridder and Henry W. Sackett

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ridder and Sackett were the Acting President and Secretary, respectively, of the Celebration Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presented September 27-October 30 in cooperation with the Colonial Dames of America.

did.unittitle: Historical Explanation of the Dutch Floats booklet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issued by the Holland Hudson-Fulton Society of Albany and Vicinity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issued by the Brooklyn Citizens' Committee.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The donor described her experience at the celebration in notes that accompany this item: "My sister Ruth and I were dressed in Japanese costumes and rode on the Japanese float in the section of the parade on 4th Avenue, Brooklyn, which originated at the Fourth Avenue Methodist Church...refreshments at the church consisted of tea, rice cakes, and other Japanese delicacies, with ice cream for the children."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper napkin used at the refreshment period following the Hudson-Fulton Celebration in Brooklyn in 1909 and notes describing the celebration. The napkin depicts a Japanese garden, consistent with the Japanese theme of the gathering.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images of official badge and Fort Tryon monument.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The donor, Gerard W.B. Gardner, received these as a gift from his aunt Mildred K. Bindrim circa 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Six black-and-white photographic prints showing various Brooklyn and Manhattan locations at night, and illuminated with electric lights, during the Hudson-Fulton Celebration of 1909. Five of the photographs show views of buildings and monuments in Brooklyn.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Based on their markings, these items are possibly from the files of the Brooklyn Eagle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Coverage of the Celebration and images of Henry Hudson's ship The Half Moon.
